instruction:
Here is the translation of the classical Chinese text:

Fan Shi, styled Jucing, studied at the Imperial University when he was young and became a student there. He befriended Zhang Shao from Ru'nan, whose style name was Yuanbo. The two of them left together to return to their hometowns and set a date to meet again. When the promised date arrived, Yuanbo informed his mother and requested that she prepare a feast to welcome Jucing. His mother asked, "After two years of separation and a promise made over a thousand miles away, how can you be so sure that he will keep his word?" Yuanbo replied, "Jucing is a man of his word, and he will not go back on his promise." His mother said, "If that is the case, I shall brew wine for you." On the appointed day, Jucing arrived as expected. He ascended the hall, offered his respects, and they drank and parted ways happily.
output:
Fan Shi, courtesy name Juling, was a native of Jinzhang, Shanyang (present-day Jinshan County, Shandong). When he was young, he studied at the Imperial University and became one of the many students there. He was a close friend and classmate of Zhang Shao from Ru'nan. Zhang Shao's courtesy name was Yuanbo. The two of them left the University and returned to their hometowns at the same time. Before parting, Fan Shi said to Zhang Shao, "In two years, I will pay a visit to your home to meet your parents and see your children." Thus, they set a date for the visit.

As the appointed date drew near, Zhang Shao informed his mother about the promise he had made with Fan Shi and asked her to prepare a feast to welcome his guest. His mother asked, "You two have been apart for two years and live far away from each other. Are you so sure that he will keep his word?" Zhang Shao replied, "Fan Shi is a man of integrity. He will surely not break his promise." His mother said, "If that is truly the case, then I shall brew wine for you."

On the agreed-upon date, Fan Shi indeed arrived. They drank and feasted together, bidding farewell in high spirits.

instruction: The imperial edict reads: "Extraordinary achievements are reserved for those who are extraordinary. Let it be decreed that the provinces shall identify officials and commoners of outstanding talent who can be groomed for the highest positions of chancellor and prime minister, as well as those who can be entrusted with diplomatic missions to distant lands."

instruction: How to give your long-distance boyfriend a warm surprise onLaba Festival?
output:
For those who are in a long-distance relationship with their boyfriend and are unable to be there for his birthday, here are some gift ideas from online flower shops to make up for your absence:

1. Scarf: As the weather turns cooler and winter approaches, a warm and stylish scarf will be a thoughtful gift for your boyfriend. Opt for colors like blue, gray, or coffee, and if you have the time, knitting one yourself will make it even more special and likely to be cherished by him.

2. Couple Jewelry: Many couples enjoy wearing clothing and jewelry that bear each other's marks, such as matching couple outfits or accessories engraved with each other's names. Consider getting couple rings, earrings, bracelets, or pendants. There are plenty of shops that offer couple DIY accessories, so you can wear one piece while sending the other to your long-distance love. Even if you're not physically together, your hearts will still be connected.

3. Flowers: Birthdays are incomplete without flowers! Flowers add a touch of romance and warmth to your already intense love. Send your boyfriend flowers like sunflowers, red roses, or scented lilies, which all symbolize love and affection. Instead of a single type of flower, go for a bouquet with a variety of blooms to make it look richer and more thoughtful. 

When celebrating your long-distance boyfriend's birthday, it's ideal to be together, but if that's not possible, make sure to send a thoughtful gift to show you care.

instruction: Why can a sore throat lead to death in a short time? Is this a precursor to sudden death?
output:
A sore throat in itself will not lead to death in a short period of time, but it could be a sign or symptom indicating a more serious underlying illness. For instance, respiratory infections such as tonsillitis or pharyngitis can cause a sore throat, and these issues may lead to more severe complications such as pneumonia or myocarditis. 

Furthermore, some diseases may exhibit precursory signs or warning signals before onset, which could be the body's final cry for help. For example, heart diseases such as angina or myocardial infarction may present with symptoms like chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea, dizziness, and sweating. Neglecting these symptoms could lead to sudden death. 

Therefore, it is imperative to seek timely medical attention and consult professional doctors when experiencing any discomfort or symptoms. Do not rely on the internet or self-diagnosis for treatment as it may lead to severe consequences.

instruction: Why is the washing machine able to clean clothes?
output:
The washing machine was invented in the 19th century. Washing machines can be generally categorized into agitator-type, impeller-type, and drum-type. The agitator-type washing machine marked the beginning of modern laundry technology and was the first true revolution in laundry, freeing human hands from the chore ever since.

Agitator-type washing machines apply the principle of agitation, using chemical and mechanical actions to clean clothes. Impeller-type washing machines have a simpler structure and can be further divided into two types: semi-automatic twin-tub and fully automatic impeller. They generate a strong water flow by rapidly rotating the impeller at the bottom, and the friction between clothes, water flow, and the tub removes dirt.

The drum-type washing machine is the most popular type worldwide. After more than 80 years of technological development, it represents mature modern laundry technology. Its washing principle involves rotating the inner drum clockwise and counterclockwise, lifting and dropping the clothes and water; allowing the detergent to thoroughly penetrate the clothes, and cleaning them through squeezing, beating actions, and overhead spraying water flow. Drum-type washing machines have not only led another new revolution in laundry technology but also continue to improve with the development of smart technology.

The washing machine that does not use detergent is a new type of ultrasonic washing machine that does not require the addition of any substances. Its working principle is based on high-frequency vibration signals generated by an ultrasonic generator, which are converted by a transducer and propagated into the water. This creates countless tiny bubbles in the water flow, and the momentary high pressure causes the bubbles to produce a series of miniature "explosions," continuously impacting the surface of the clothes and dislodging dirt and grime from the surface and crevices of the fabric.

instruction: What are the three cosmic velocities?
output:
According to scientific calculations, as long as an object reaches a speed of 7.9 meters per second and is thrown out horizontally, it can orbit the Earth. This speed is called the first cosmic velocity. If an object reaches a speed of 11.2 kilometers per second, it can overcome the Earth's gravity and fly to other planets in the solar system. This speed is called the second cosmic velocity.

If an object travels at a speed of 16.7 kilometers per second, it can fly out of the solar system and reach other star systems. This speed is called the third cosmic velocity.

instruction:
Please answer this question:
How do fish breathe?
output: Answer: The gills of fish are located on both sides of the head. When a fish breathes, it opens its mouth to take in water, which then passes through the buccal cavity. The fish then closes its mouth, and as the water flows over the gills, the dissolved oxygen in the water permeates into the gills and is carried by blood vessels back to the heart to be circulated throughout the body. At the same time, carbon dioxide in the blood is released through the gill's capillaries into the water, completing the gas exchange process. The fish then opens its operculum (gill cover) to expel the water through the gill slits.

instruction: Why does the wolf howl at night?
output:
In the world, animals of all kinds have their own habits. Wolves are carnivorous beasts that prey on rabbits, wild chickens, field mice, fawns, lambs, and so on. They will eat carrion and even resort to cannibalism. Wolf packs can sometimes pose a danger to humans. Wolves have a large appetite and can consume dozens of pounds of meat in one sitting. They can also go for months without food while remaining fiercely aggressive.

Wolves are nocturnal creatures, typically emerging at dusk to hunt in packs. As they move, they emit low howls. Animal calls are a means of communication, with different calls conveying different messages and playing a significant role in their breeding habits.

The purpose of howling at night is to gather as a pack. For example, a mother wolf may howl to call her cubs, and a male wolf may respond to the female's call. Once assembled, they venture out to hunt. During the breeding season, wolves may also howl to find mates. Young wolves, when hungry, will emit high-pitched cries.

Wolves pose a severe threat to domestic fowl, livestock, and various wild animals. Therefore, they are considered pests and should be hunted in a controlled manner.

instruction: Why is atmospheric pressure higher in winter than in summer?
output: When air is heated, it expands and its density decreases. As a result, the weight of the air column per unit area decreases, leading to a drop in air pressure. Conversely, when air pressure increases, it is because the air has contracted and its density has increased. Therefore, air pressure in winter is higher than in summer. You may ask: If the air is expanding everywhere in the summer, where does the excess air go? It is because the seasons in the Northern and Southern Hemispheres of the Earth are opposite. So the extra air expanded in the summer hemisphere goes to the winter hemisphere to make up for the lack of air there.

instruction:
Here is the translation of the classical Chinese text:

"When Chen Shi was in his hometown, he approached everything with a calm and impartial mind. Whenever there was a dispute, he would seek to judge and rectify the situation, explaining the rights and wrongs of the matter. Those involved would leave without bearing any grudge. People would even go so far as to say, 'I would rather be punished by the law than be looked down upon by Mr. Chen.' During a time of famine and hardship, a thief broke into his house one night and hid on the beam. Chen Shi, who had noticed the intruder, got up, straightened his clothes, called for his children and grandchildren, and sternly taught them, 'One must strive to improve oneself. A person who does evil is not necessarily inherently bad; it is their habits and nature that have led them to this point. The gentleman above us on the beam is a fine example of this!' The thief was greatly shocked. He threw himself to the ground and confessed his wrongdoing. Chen Shi calmly explained to him, 'From your appearance, you do not seem like an evil person. You should deeply reflect on yourself and strive to be good. However, your actions are likely driven by poverty.' Chen Shi then ordered that the thief be given two bolts of silk. From that point on, there were no more thefts in the entire county."
output: Chen Shi in the countryside, treated things with a peaceful mind. When disputes and lawsuits arose among the common people, Chen Shi ruled impartially, explaining to the common people the rights and wrongs of things, and the common people did not grumble after returning home. Everyone exclaimed, "I would rather be punished than be criticized by Chen Shi." At that time, the harvest was poor and the people had no harvest. There was a thief who entered Chen Shi's house at night and hid on the rafter. Chen Shi secretly discovered this, so he got up and straightened his clothes, calling his children and grandchildren together, and admonished them sternly, "A man must strive to improve himself. A person who is not virtuous may not be inherently bad, but bad habits are often formed by a lack of attention to one's character. The gentleman on the rafter is such a person." The thief was greatly alarmed and jumped from the rafter to the ground, kneeling and confessing sincerely. Chen Shi slowly said to him, "Looking at your appearance, you don't seem like a bad person. You should restrain yourself and return to the right path. However, your actions are probably due to poverty." In the end, he also gave the thief two bolts of silk. From then on, there were no more thefts in the entire county.

instruction:
Here is the translation of the classical Chinese text:

"Fan Yang Zu Ti was a man of great ambition from a young age. He and Liu Kun both served as chief clerks of the governor of Si Province and shared a bedroom. One midnight, he kicked Liu Kun awake upon hearing a rooster crowing and said, 'This is not an unpleasant sound!' Then he started dancing. After crossing the river, the Left Prime Minister Wei appointed him as a military advisor. While residing in Jingkou, Zu Ti gathered brave and strong men and said to Wei, 'The chaos in the Jin dynasty is not because of the emperor's cruelty and the people's resentment, but because of the power struggle among the imperial clan, who tear each other apart, allowing barbarians to take advantage of the situation and spread their poison throughout the land. Now, the survivors have suffered from the ravages of bandits, and the people wish to rise up and fight. Your Majesty, if you truly send a general to lead an army and put someone like me in charge, we can restore the Central Plains, and heroes in the counties and duchies will surely respond to our call.' Prime Minister Wei had never harbored any intention to campaign in the north. He appointed Zu Ti as the General of Courageous Might and Governor of Yu Province, providing him with provisions for a thousand people and three thousand bolts of cloth, but no armor or weapons, and instructed him to recruit his soldiers. Zu Ti led his clan, consisting of over a hundred households, across the river. In the middle of the river, he struck the oar and swore, 'If I, Zu Ti, fail to pacify the Central Plains and return, may I be cast into the mighty river!' He then stationed his troops in Huai Yin, started metallurgy to forge weapons, and recruited over two thousand men before advancing further."
output:
Here is the translation of the provided Chinese text into English:

"Fan Yang native Zu Ti, even in his youth, had grand ambitions to restore the Central Plains to glory. Once, while serving as a chief clerk in Si Province together with Liu Kun, the two shared a bedroom. In the middle of the night, upon hearing a rooster crow, Zu kicked Liu awake, saying, 'This is not a hateful sound (or an ill omen).' He then rose and danced with his sword. After crossing the river, the Left Prime Minister, Sima Rui, appointed him as the Chief Military Official. 

Zu Ti, residing in Jingkou, gathered a group of valiant and robust soldiers. He said to Sima Rui, 'The turmoil in the Jin Dynasty is not due to a tyrannical ruler causing resentment and rebellion among his subjects. Instead, it is the power struggle and mutual slaughter among the imperial kinsmen that have given the Rong and Di people an opportunity to create havoc, spreading calamity across the Central Plains. Now, the surviving people of the Jin Dynasty, having endured devastation and harm, all aspire to strengthen themselves. Your Majesty, if you dispatch a general with troops and appoint someone like me to lead the army to restore the Central Plains, there will surely be heroes and brave men across the lands who will be inspired and respond enthusiastically!' 

Sima Rui had never harbored ambitions for a northern expedition, but after hearing Zu Ti's words, he appointed Zu as the General of Valiant Might and Governor of Yu Province. However, he only allocated provisions for a thousand men and three thousand bolts of fabric, without supplying armor or weapons, leaving Zu Ti to figure out how to recruit and equip his troops. 

Leading his private army of over a hundred households, Zu Ti crossed the Yangtze River. In the middle of the river, he struck the boat's oar and proclaimed, 'If Zu Ti fails to bring peace and restoration to the Central Plains, he shall be like the mighty river, flowing away and never returning!' They then stationed themselves in Huai'yin, set up furnaces to smelt and cast weapons, recruited over two thousand more men, and continued on their journey."

instruction:

The Prime Minister of Qin, in his later years, held even greater power. He always had several soldiers, dressed in plain clothes and carrying clubs, standing outside his office. Whenever passersby paused to look or whisper, the soldiers would immediately stop them. On one occasion, he took a day or two off due to illness, and the official in charge of governance had an audience with him. The official did not dare speak of anything else and only extolled the Prime Minister's achievements and merits, which were unparalleled in the world. The next day, when the official entered the hall, the Prime Minister suddenly asked, "I heard you had a long discussion yesterday?" The official, filled with dread, replied, "I only spoke of your Excellency's merits and achievements, which are unparalleled in the world. As soon as I finished speaking, I retired, and I did not speak of anything else." The Prime Minister laughed and said, "I am deeply grateful!" It turned out that he had already instigated the officials in charge of reporting to submit a memorial. As soon as the governing official returned home, a copy of the memorial submitted by the cabinet had already arrived. He was so vindictive and petty-minded.

Usually, there were several soldiers dressed in black and armed with clubs standing at the entrance of his residence. Anyone who dared to glance into the compound would be scolded. Once, when Qin Hui took a day or two off due to illness and did not attend the imperial court, the other minister in charge had to face the emperor alone. This minister dared not say anything about Qin Hui and could only continuously praise him in front of the emperor. The next day, when Qin Hui arrived for the morning court session, he suddenly asked the minister, "I heard you spoke for a long time in front of His Majesty yesterday?" The minister, fearful, replied, "I only praised your unparalleled virtues and then retired. I truly did not speak of anything else." Qin Hui laughed and said, "Thank you so much!" It turned out that he had already instigated officials to impeach the minister, and as soon as the latter returned home, a copy of the cabinet's impeachment was delivered to his residence. Such was the extent of Qin Hui's viciousness.

"An Shiyi was tall and sturdy, with a voice like a bell. When he was first appointed as an advisor, before taking the oath of office, he went to his mother and said, 'The court does not consider me unworthy and has placed me in a position of influence. Should I take up this post, I must do so with integrity and courage, ready to face any consequences that may arise from speaking truth to power. The Emperor rules with filial piety; if I were to use your old age as an excuse to decline, I might be spared.' His mother said, 'No, I've heard that advisors are the Emperor's disputing subjects. Your father always wanted this position but never got the chance. Now that you have this opportunity, you must dedicate yourself to serving the country. Even if you are punished and exiled, no matter how far away, I will follow you.' And so he accepted the appointment. For many years, he served with integrity, standing firm in the face of adversity. When he had to confront the Emperor directly, even when the Emperor was furious, he would hold his tablet and stand his ground, waiting for the anger to subside before continuing to speak his mind. Those who attended the court from a distance would watch in awe, their bodies shrinking with fear, and they would call him 'Tiger of the Court.' Such was the respect and awe he commanded."
output: An Shi had a tall and robust stature, a dignified appearance, and a voice like a bell. He was initially appointed as an advisor, and before taking up the post, he returned home and said to his mother: "The court does not consider me, An Shi, unworthy and appoints me as an advisor. If I take up this position, I must have the courage to uphold justice without fear and to take on responsibilities with my life. If I offend the Emperor, disaster and demotion will surely follow. The Emperor governs the world with filial piety. If I use the excuse of your old age, I should be able to avoid taking up this position." His mother said: "That would be wrong. I've heard that an advisor is a close and bold minister who speaks his mind in front of the Emperor. Your father wanted to be such an official all his life but couldn't, and now you have the fortune to take up this role. You should dedicate your life to repay the country's great grace. Even if you are punished and exiled, no matter how far, I will surely accompany you." (An Shi) accepted the position. He served for many years, standing solemnly in the court and upholding fairness. instruction: Why is fifteen minutes called a quarter?
output: In ancient China, time was not measured with clocks or watches. Back then, time was told by observing the water level in a copper vessel against the marked graduations. Later, when clocks were introduced to China from the West, someone conducted an experiment. They found that the time it takes for a clock to tick fifteen minutes is exactly the same as the time it takes for one graduation to drip in the copper vessel. Thus, people also started referring to fifteen minutes as a "quarter" or "one tick" of the clock.

instruction: Why is the radio in the train not making any sound?
output:
This is because the conditions for a radio to function are not met inside a train carriage. Radios rely on magnetic wireless reception of radio station signals. Normally, after the antenna receives the radio waves, the radio can play sound through the various parts of the radio. However, a train carriage is made of metal sheets, which do not allow the penetration of radio waves.

Without the reception of radio waves, a radio cannot function normally and thus, no sound is heard.

instruction: Why can radar measure wind and rain?
output: The radar used to measure wind and rain is called a weather radar. When measuring wind, meteorologists first release a hydrogen balloon with a metal reflector target. The radar then sends radio waves to the metal reflector target, and the strength of the reflected waves causes the echoes displayed on the radar screen to vary in brightness. The brighter the echo, the larger the diameter of the water droplets in the cloud layer, which can be used to determine whether the cloud layer will produce rain.

instruction: Why is Confucius revered as a saint?
output:
Confucius had a profound influence on posterity. Although he "expounded but did not create," he was already renowned in his lifetime as the "Sage Sent by Heaven," the "Wooden Gong of Heaven," and the "Sage of All Ages," and was one of the most erudite scholars of his time.

Later generations further revered him as the "Ultimate Sage" (the sage among sages) and the "Eternal Teacher for All Generations." It is believed that he revised the "Book of Songs" and the "Book of Documents," established the rituals and music, and sequenced the "Zhou Yi" (also known as the "Yi Jing" or the "Ten Wings of Changes"), and authored the "Spring and Autumn Annals." The "Analects of Confucius" is one of the classic works of the Confucian school, compiled by Confucius's disciples and their followers. It primarily consists of recorded sayings and dialogues of Confucius and his disciples, encapsulating his political ideals, ethical thoughts, moral principles, and educational philosophies. Together with the "Great Learning," the "Doctrine of the Mean," and the "Mengzi," it is known as one of the "Four Books." The standard edition of the "Analects of Confucius" comprises twenty chapters. The language of the "Analects" is concise and refined, and its meanings are profound. Many of Confucius's sayings are still regarded as timeless truths by people today.

instruction: Why do table tennis paddles have a rubber surface on both sides?
output:
For table tennis players who are good at close-to-table quick attacks, the most suitable racket is a sponge racket with a pimpled rubber facing outwards. The contact area between the rubber and the ball is small, and the ball stays on the pimples for a short time, which results in a faster rebound speed and benefits faster attacks. Athletes who are good at loop drives and cuts usually choose reversed-rubber rackets. Because the pimples on the rubber face inward, there is an extra layer of pimples between the rubber and the sponge, and there are gaps between the pimples. When the racket hits the ball, the rubber surface will concave inward, increasing the contact area and friction with the ball. 

It is this "stickiness" and larger friction of the racket surface that makes the topspin loop drives and backspin cuts spin more fiercely.

instruction: The term "sha qing", often used in film production to indicate the completion of filming, originally referred to the process of removing the green leaves from tea plants during tea processing.
output:
The term "killing the green" (sha qing) originated in the pre-Qin era. 

Back then, books were mostly made of bamboo strips (called "jian") and wooden strips ("du"). The process started by carving characters into the strips, then punching holes on one side, and finally binding them together with silk threads or leather straps to form a book shaped like the Chinese character "ce." However, the surface of the bamboo strips, known as "zhu qing," contained oily components that made carving difficult, and bamboo was also susceptible to insect damage. Therefore, ancient people came up with a solution: they placed the bamboo strips over a fire to roast them. This process of roasting, or "killing the green," made it easier to carve characters and also prevented insect damage, becoming an essential step in the book-making process.

This step was called "killing the green" ("sha qing"), and it was also known as "sweating the blue" ("han qing" or "han jian"). Thus, the term "sha qing" came into being. 

By the time of the Qin Dynasty, brushes were invented, and the characters on the bamboo and wooden strips could be written with brushes instead of being carved with knives. At that time, people often composed their drafts using brushes on the zhu qing surface because it was smooth, and any corrections could be easily wiped away. Once the draft was finalized, the zhu qing layer would be scraped off, and the final version would be written on the white bamboo surface. This process was also called "killing the green."

instruction: Why are fire trucks painted red?
output:
We usually see fire engines that are mostly red. Why are fire engines painted red? There is a scientific reason behind this.

Sunlight is composed of seven colors: red, orange, yellow, green, cyan, blue, and violet, each with a different wavelength and deflection angle. When sunlight shines on an object, the object's ability to absorb and reflect light of different wavelengths varies, thus forming different colors. In simple terms, if an object can reflect one or a few types of light from sunlight and absorb the rest, then the object will appear to be the color or colors of the reflected light. In the visible light spectrum, red light has the longest wavelength and the smallest deflection angle, making it easy to pass through water layers, raindrops, dust, and mist. Orange and yellow light are also unobstructed and can penetrate the aforementioned objects. Therefore, fire engines are painted red so that people can spot them from a distance in weather conditions such as dense fog, dusty environments, or heavy storms, allowing them to yield and thus facilitating the fire engine to reach its destination quickly for fire fighting and rescue missions.

instruction: Why does a leopard drag its prey up a tree to eat?

Food hanging high in a tree can effectively prevent theft by other carnivorous and scavenging animals.

"The Duke of Jing asked Yanzi, 'What is the greatest danger to a country?' Yanzi replied, 'The greatest danger is the shrine mouse.' The Duke asked, 'What do you mean?' Yanzi answered, 'The shrine is made of bundled wood that is painted. Mice take refuge in it, and when smoked, they fear the wood will burn, and when drenched, they fear the paint will peel. This is why the mice cannot be killed, because they are protected by the shrine. Similarly, a country also has its shrine mice in the form of the ruler's favorites. They conceal the good and evil from their lord and sell their influence to the people. If they are not punished, they will cause chaos, and if punished, they become a burden on the ruler, who bears the blame. These, too, are the shrine mice of the state.'"
output: Prince Jing of Qi (given name: Jiù, surname: Jiāng) asked Yanzi, "What is the most feared thing in governing a state?" Yanzi replied, "It is the temple mouse." When asked about the meaning, Yanzi explained, "The character 'sì' (temple) refers to arranging pieces of wood side by side and coating them with mud, which then becomes a habitat for mice. If you smoke them out, you risk burning the wood; if you flush them out with water, you risk damaging the mud coating. These mice cannot be eradicated because they are sheltered by the temple. The same can be said of the court favorites who surround a ruler. Within the court, they obscure the distinction between good and evil for the ruler, and outside the court, they flaunt their power over the people. If you do not eliminate them, they will wreak havoc on the state; but if you try to get rid of them, the ruler will shield them, making it difficult to impose punishment." This is the "temple mouse" of the state.

instruction:
Please answer this question:

In mathematics, what is a group action?

In mathematics, a group action is a formal way of describing how one set, called the group, acts on or transforms another set, called the action set or simply the action. The group action can be defined as a map from the Cartesian product of the group and the action set to the action set itself, satisfying certain conditions. Specifically, for a group (G, *) and an action set X, a group action is a map:

> a: G × X → X

such that for any g, h in G and any x in X, we have:

> a(g, a(h, x)) = a(g * h, x)
> a(e, x) = x

where e is the identity element of the group G.

The first condition ensures that the group operation is compatible with the action, and the second condition ensures that the identity element of the group leaves every element of the action set invariant under the action.

Group actions are fundamental concepts in algebra and have wide applications in various fields, including geometry, physics, and computer science. They provide a way to understand symmetry and describe the behavior of mathematical objects under certain transformations.
output: Answer: Group action refers to the action of a group on a set, describing how group elements transform or operate on the elements in the set. Group action associates group elements with set elements through a mapping, satisfying certain properties and axioms.

instruction:
Please answer this question:

In mathematics, what is a Riemann integral?

The Riemann integral, named after German mathematician Bernhard Riemann, is a fundamental concept in calculus that provides a precise definition of the integral of a function. It allows us to calculate the area under a curve or, more generally, the volume bounded by a surface or higher-dimensional manifold.

The key idea behind the Riemann integral is the partitioning of an interval or region into smaller subintervals or subregions and the evaluation of the function at selected points within each subinterval or subregion. By considering the sum of the function values at these points weighted by the width or size of the subintervals or subregions, we can approximate the total area or volume.

More specifically, for a function f defined on an interval [a, b], a Riemann sum is formed by dividing the interval into n subintervals, selecting a sample point xi in each subinterval, and calculating the product of f(xi) and the width of the subinterval. The Riemann integral is then defined as the limit of the Riemann sums as the number of subintervals approaches infinity, provided that such a limit exists and is unique.

The Riemann integral has several important properties, including linearity, additivity, and monotonicity. It also satisfies the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, which establishes the connection between differentiation and integration. The Riemann integral is widely used in various fields, including physics, engineering, economics, and probability theory, providing a powerful tool for solving problems involving rates of change, accumulated quantities, and probability distributions.
output: Answer: Riemann integral is a definite integral of a function over an interval, usually used to calculate the area under a curve.

Traffic pollution is mainly caused by vehicle exhaust emissions, particularly from automobiles and motorcycles, which release carbon dioxide, carbon monoxide, nitrogen oxides, and other pollutants. Coal, as the primary energy source in China, contributes significantly to air pollution through the release of substantial amounts of carbon dioxide, sulfur dioxide, and particulate matter during combustion. The burning of biomass, such as crop straw and firewood, is commonly practiced in rural areas, producing smoke and pollutants. The Chinese government is committed to reducing these sources of pollution, improving air quality, and safeguarding public health.

instruction: How to Treat Flea Bites?

Fleas bites will heal on their own without treatment. However, to prevent being bitten, you must get rid of the fleas themselves.

To alleviate the symptoms of flea bites, you may try using over-the-counter anti-itch creams and antihistamines.

Refrain from scratching the bitten areas. If you notice signs of infection, such as white pus or a rash, at the site of the bite, please make an appointment to see a doctor.

instruction:
Reference the paragraph below, then answer the subsequent question in the same language:

Via: involving people at all levels of the organization in kaizen, from the CEO to the janitor, and external stakeholders when applicable. Most often associated with manufacturing, such as Toyota, kaizen is also used in non-manufacturing environments. Kaizen can take the form of individuals, suggestion systems, small groups, or large groups. At Toyota, this usually involves localized improvements to a particular workstation or area and involves a group improving their own workspace and productivity. A first-line supervisor typically guides this group through the kaizen process; sometimes this is also a key role for the line supervisor. Achieve comprehensive quality management, increase productivity through the use of machinery and computational power, and free up manpower. While kaizen (at Toyota) typically brings about small improvements, the culture of constantly tweaking small improvements and standardization has yielded significant results in overall productivity gains. This philosophy differs from mid-20th-century "command-and-control" improvement schemes (e.g., business process improvement). The kaizen approach includes making changes, monitoring the results, and then adjusting. Massive pre-planning and extensive project scheduling are replaced by smaller experiments that can quickly adapt as new improvement suggestions arise. Their scope is limited, and the issues generated from them are often used for later kaizen events. Individuals who make significant contributions to successful kaizen implementations during kaizen activities are awarded the title of "Zen Kaizen-sha."

As a way to help clients restructure and reposition their business processes, business consultants around the world began widely adopting and sharing the Kaizen framework in the 21st century.

Q: How do employees at the Toyota company improve productivity?

A: 丰田公司的员工通过持续改进工作站或工作区的局部改进来提高生产率，这涉及到一个小组改善自己的工作环境和生产力。这个过程由一线主管提供指导，有时线主管也会发挥关键作用。他们利用机械和计算能力提高生产力，实现全面的质量管理，并释放人力。虽然每次改善的幅度很小，但不断调整和标准化的文化使这些小改进累积起来带来了显著的整体生产力提升。与20世纪中叶的“指挥和控制”改进计划（例如，业务流程改进）不同，丰田的改善方法包括实施改变、监测结果，然后根据需要进行调整。大规模预先计划和广泛的项目安排被更灵活的小型实验所取代，这些实验可以根据新的改进建议迅速调整。员工在开斋活动中提出的问题通常会被后续的开斋事件所采用。在开斋活动中为开斋成功实施做出重大贡献的人将获得“禅开先师”的称号。
output: By using machines and computational power to enhance productivity, achieve comprehensive quality management, and free up manpower.

instruction: (Han) Xin often spoke with Xiao He, and He was astonished by him. When they arrived at Nanzheng, several dozen generals who were escorting the emperor escaped. Xin guessed that He had already reported his talent to the emperor several times, but the emperor did not employ him, so he decided to escape. When He heard that Xin had escaped, he did not report it to the emperor and went to pursue him by himself. Someone told the emperor, "Chancellor He has escaped." The emperor was extremely angry, as if he had lost his right hand. After a day or two, He came to meet the emperor. The emperor was both angry and happy. He scolded He, "Why did you escape?" He replied, "I dare not escape. I went to pursue the escaped man." The emperor asked, "Who did you pursue?" He answered, "Han Xin." The emperor scolded again, "Several dozen generals have escaped, and you did not pursue any of them. Pursuing Xin is deceitful." He said, "It is easy to find those generals. As for Xin, he is a peerless talent in the country. If Your Majesty wants to be the king of Hanzhong, you don't need to employ Xin. But if you want to compete for the world, there is no one but Xin who can assist you in planning. It depends on what strategy Your Majesty chooses."
output: Han Xin again had several conversations with Xiao He, and Xiao He also admired him greatly. (Most of the king of Han's subordinates were Easterners, and they all wanted to return to their hometowns.) Therefore, when the team arrived in Nanzheng, dozens of officers had deserted along the way. Han Xin guessed that Xiao He and the others had already recommended him to the king of Han many times, but the king of Han had not been reusing himself, so he also ran away. When Xiao He heard that Han Xin had run away, he did not have time to report the matter to the king of Han, so he went to chase him down. Someone who did not know the details reported to the king of Han: "Chancellor Xiao He has run away." The king of Han was extremely angry, as if he had lost his right-hand man. After a day or two, Xiao He returned to see the king of Han, and the king of Han was both angry and pleased. He scolded: "Why did you run away?" Xiao He replied: "I dare not run away, I was chasing the runaway person." "Who did you bring back?" asked the king of Han. "Han Xin," replied Xiao He. The king of Han scolded again: "Dozens of officers have run away, and you didn't chase any of them. Instead, you went after Han Xin. This is a lie." Xiao He said, "Those officers are easy to come by, but a talent like Han Xin is a one-in-a-million find. Your Majesty, if you just want to remain as the king of Hanzhong, then of course you won't need him. But if you want to compete for the world, then apart from Han Xin, there is no one else with whom you can discuss grand plans. It all depends on what Your Majesty intends to do."

instruction: The emperor, at the Cuiwei Palace, asked his attendant ministers: "Since ancient times, emperors, though having pacified the Central Plains, were unable to subdue the Rong and Di peoples. I, with talents inferior to the ancients, have achieved greater success than them, and I do not understand the reason for this. All of you, please speak your mind." The ministers all praised: "Your Majesty's grace is as vast as the universe, beyond the expression of words." The emperor said: "Not so. The reason I have achieved this is solely due to five things. Since ancient times, emperors have often despised those better than themselves. I, when seeing the goodness in others, feel as if it is my own. As people cannot be perfect, I always discard their shortcomings and embrace their strengths. Emperors often wish to favor the wise by keeping them close, and get rid of the unworthy by pushing them away. I, when encountering the wise, respect them, and when encountering the unworthy, pity them, so that each finds their proper place. Emperors often dislike those who are upright and honest, secretly punishing and openly executing them, and this has happened in every dynasty. Since my ascension, upright and honest scholars have filled the court, and I have never demoted or punished a single one. Since ancient times, emperors have valued the Central Plains and looked down upon the barbarians. I alone have loved them equally, and so their tribes have relied on me as they would their parents. These five reasons are why I have achieved the success of today." Then he turned to Chu Suiliang and asked: "You have been a historian. Regarding what I have said, have I truly grasped the essence?" Chu replied: "Your Majesty's virtues are boundless and immeasurable. These five things you mentioned are but a humble expression of your modesty."
output:
Tang Taizong was in the Cuiwei Palace when he asked his attendant ministers, "Since ancient times, emperors have pacified the Central Plains and the Huaxia people, but they have not been able to subjugate the ethnic minorities in the northwest. My talent is not superior to that of the ancient emperors, yet my achievements are greater than theirs. I don't know the reason for this. Please be frank and tell me." 

The ministers replied, "Your Majesty's merit and virtue are as vast as the heavens and the earth. There is nothing more to say about other things." 

Tang Taizong said, "This is not the case. The reason I have such achievements is simply because I have done the following five things: First, since ancient times, emperors have often been jealous of those who are better than them. When I see the strengths of others, I treat them as my own strengths and regard them as if they were my own virtues. Second, no one is perfect, so I focus on their strengths and overlook their weaknesses. Third, most monarchs want to keep talented people close when they see their good qualities, but want to push them into the abyss when they see their flaws. However, when I encounter talented and virtuous people, I respect them, and when I see those who are not performing well, I educate them from a caring perspective. In this way, both the capable and the less capable are given their due respect and guidance. Fourth, most monarchs dislike being criticized directly and often secretly harm or openly attack those who speak up. However, since I ascended the throne, there have been many who have spoken frankly, and not one of them has been dismissed because of their honesty. Fifth, traditionally, the Han ethnicity was considered superior, and discrimination against ethnic minorities was common. However, I have treated everyone equally and with care, so the ethnic minorities have come to rely on me as they would their parents. These five points are the reasons for my success today."

instruction:
Here is the translation of the Chinese text:

"From my youth, I have loved learning; for more than forty years, I have never put aside a book. I eat to satisfy my hunger, and I rest my head in laziness. If a scholar-official's family has unusual books, I borrow them and read them all without fail, reading each one from cover to cover before stopping. I often hate not having the resources to be able to transcribe them all. Occasionally, I compile several tens of large volumes, selecting those that are useful and copying them out by hand, and I call this collection 'Hai Lu' [Sea Collection]."
output: When I was young, I loved to learn. For over forty years, I never let go of books. I held them in my hands while eating, and the food tasted sweet in my mouth. When I was tired, I used them as a pillow. If a scholar's family had unique books, I would borrow and read them without fail. I would not stop reading until I had finished the entire book. I often regretted not having the wealth to copy them all. Out of so many books, I selected several dozen volumes and chose the useful parts to copy by hand, naming the compilation "Hai Lu" (海录).

instruction:
Here is the translation of the provided Chinese text into English:

"In governing a nation, it is imperative to enrich the people first. When the people are prosperous, they are easier to govern; when the people are impoverished, they are difficult to govern. How do we know this to be true? When the people are prosperous, they value their communities and families, leading to respect for authority and fear of transgressing the law, making them easier to govern. Conversely, when the people are impoverished, they disregard their communities and families, emboldening them to defy authority and break the rules, thus making governance challenging. Therefore, nations that are well-governed are often prosperous, while those in chaos are often poor. Hence, a wise leader of a nation must first enrich the people and only then proceed to govern them."
output: The principles of governing a country are to first ensure the people's wealth. When the people are wealthy, they are easily governed; when they are poor, they are hard to govern. Why is this so? When the people are wealthy, they are content to remain in their villages and cherish their homes. When they are content and cherish their homes, they will respect their rulers and fear the law. When the people are poor, they become restless and disregard their homes and villages. This restlessness and disregard lead to daring to defy their rulers and violate the prohibitions. Thus, well-governed countries are often rich, while chaotic countries are invariably poor. Hence, a monarch who excels in governing a country must first enrich the people and only then proceed to govern them.

instruction:
Here is my translation of the passage from Classical Chinese to English:

Emperor Taizong of the Tang Dynasty asked Wei Zheng, "When observing the rulers of recent and ancient times, there are those who have passed on their positions through ten generations, some through one or two generations, and still, others who have gained or lost it within their own lifetimes. This is why I always live in fear and worry. I fear that I may not be able to nurture and govern the people as I should, or that I may give birth to arrogance and indulgent behavior, allowing my emotions of joy and anger to exceed what is appropriate, yet remain unaware of it. Can you offer me guidance so that I may have a model to follow?" 

Wei Zheng replied, "The emotions of desire, craving, joy, and anger are the same in both wise and foolish people. The wise can control and regulate them, not letting them go to extremes, while the foolish indulge them, often leading to their downfall.... I humbly hope that Your Majesty can always exercise self-control and thus preserve the beauty of ultimate success, so that countless generations may forever depend on you."
output: Emperor Taizong of Tang asked Wei Zheng, "Observing the emperors of recent times and antiquity, some have passed on the imperial position to the tenth generation, some to one or two generations, and some have gained and lost the empire themselves. The reason for my constant worry is that sometimes I fear that I do not have good ways to comfort and nurture the people, and sometimes I fear that feelings of arrogance and complacency will arise in my heart, causing happiness and anger to exceed proper limits without me even realizing it. Can you speak to this situation for me? I shall take your words as a guideline." Wei Zheng replied, "The feelings of desire, happiness, and anger are the same in saints and ordinary people. Saints are able to control them and not let them go beyond the proper limits, while ordinary people indulge them and often lose control... I hope Your Majesty can always exercise self-restraint to ensure the virtue of a good ending. Then, future generations for thousands and tens of thousands of years will forever rely on you."

instruction: What is the climate like in Italy?
output: The climate in Italy is quite diverse, and the climate in some areas may differ significantly from the typical Mediterranean climate. The northern part of Italy has a humid subtropical continental climate (according to the Köppen climate classification), including cities like Turin, Milan, and Bologna. The coastal areas of Liguria and most of the Italian peninsula south of Florence have a Mediterranean climate. The climate in the coastal areas of the peninsula varies considerably with changes in altitude and terrain. High-altitude areas experience cold, wet, and snowy winters. The coastal areas have mild winters, while summers are usually quite dry, and the lower-lying valleys can be extremely hot during the summer.

instruction:
The following is a translation of the provided Chinese text into modern Han characters:

王冕，是诸暨人。七八岁时，父亲让他到陇上牧牛，他却偷偷跑到学校，听学生们朗读书籍。听完后，就默默记下。到了晚上，他忘记了牛，回到家。父亲生气地鞭打他。他却又重蹈覆辙。母亲说：“孩子这么痴迷，为什么不让他去做他想做的事情呢？”王冕于是离家出走，依附在寺庙中居住。晚上偷偷出来，坐在佛像前，拿着书卷，对着长明的灯火朗读，读到天亮，声音清脆响亮。寺庙里的佛像大多是吓人的泥偶，但王冕还是个孩子时，却恍若未见，无所畏惧。会稽的韩性听说了这件事，觉得他很特别，于是录取他为弟子，后来他成了博学的儒者。
output: Wang Mian was a native of Zhuji County. When he was seven or eight years old, his father made him herd cattle on the ridges of the rice fields. Instead, he would sneak off to the school and listen to the students reading. After listening, he would quietly memorize what he had heard. In the evening, when he returned home, he would forget all about the cows he had been tending. Wang Mian's father would fly into a rage and beat him. But he continued to do the same thing. His mother said, "If this child is so enamored with studying, why not let him?" From then on, Wang Mian left home and lived in a temple. At night, he would quietly come out and sit on the lap of a Buddha statue, book in hand, reading by the light of the eternal lamp before the Buddha. He would read aloud, his voice echoing, until dawn. The Buddha statues were mostly made of clay, each with a fierce and ugly face that was frightening to behold. Though Wang Mian was but a child, he remained calm and seemed not to notice. Han Xing of Anyang heard of this and, finding him extraordinary, took him on as a student. Thus, Wang Mian became a learned and talented scholar.

instruction: Why don't we see sea turtle corpses?
output:
Whether on the shore or under the sea, turtle corpses are rarely found. Does that mean they are immortal? No. It is said that turtles, like elephants on land, can predict when they will die and thus search for their final resting place. They find a cave, crawl through the entrance, navigate a long passage, and reach a spacious cavern where they quietly lie still until they pass away.

A Japanese photographer and three divers discovered a turtle graveyard in an underwater cave 25 meters deep off the coast of Pulau Redang, Malaysia, with the remains of approximately 30 turtles scattered within.

instruction: Why do moths fly into flames?
output:
The eyes of a moth cannot withstand the stimulation of light. Once its eyes come into contact with light, its nerves become confused, and the nerves in this part will affect the muscles of the wings near the light.

As a result, the strength of the two wings becomes imbalanced, with one side stronger and the other weaker, making it unable to fly straight ahead and only able to circle the light. If the light has a flame, the moth will fly in increasingly smaller circles until it eventually plunges into the flame and burns to death.

instruction: Where do fleas bite dogs?
output:
The flea bites on dogs look very similar to bite wounds on human skin. They form tiny red bumps, sometimes with a red circle around them. 

It may be more difficult to find these bites under your pet's thick fur. One telltale sign that your dog has been bitten is frequent scratching. You may also notice areas of hair loss or red patches on your animal's skin. 

Search for these tiny creatures in your dog's fur using a flea comb. You are most likely to find them at the base of your pet's neck, abdomen, lower back, and tail. 

If you don't see actual fleas, you may instead find their droppings, or what is called "flea dirt." They look like small specks of black pepper on your dog's skin.

instruction: Why is there a uvula in the throat?
output:
At the place where the nose and mouth connect, there is a small tongue called the "uvula." When we eat, the little tongue lifts up and blocks the passage between the mouth and nose, preventing food from rushing into the nose.

When seeing a doctor, the doctor often asks the patient to open their mouth wide and say "ah." The purpose is to check if the little tongue is red and swollen, which helps diagnose if the patient's throat is inflamed.

instruction:
Here is the translation of the classical Chinese text:

"Mǐn Zhòngshū from Tàiyuán, his family had a reputation for being principled scholars. Even though Zhōu Dǎng was known for his integrity, Mǐn Zhòngshū did not think he could compare to him. When Dǎng saw that he was eating beans and drinking water, he gave him raw garlic, which he accepted but did not eat. During the Jìanwǔ period, he responded to the recruitment drive by Hóu Bà, the Grand Commandant. However, upon arriving, he found that Hóu Bà was not actually involved in state affairs, and his recruitment drive was just a pretense that brought people trouble and hardship. Disappointed, Mǐn Zhòngshū said, 'When I first received the honorable invitation, I was both delighted and apprehensive. Now that I have met Your Excellency, those feelings have vanished. Do you think I am not worth consulting, and that's why you didn't seek my advice? Inviting someone and then not seeking their counsel is a waste of a person's talent.' He then took his leave, submitted a petition of impeachment, and departed."
output: There was a man named Min Zhongshu in Taiyuan, and everyone said that he was a man of integrity. Even Zhou Dang, a man of such integrity and purity, considered himself inferior to Min Zhongshu. When Zhou Dang saw that Min Zhongshu came to drink water with beans in his mouth, he gave him raw garlic, which Min Zhongshu accepted but did not eat. In the middle of Jianwu, Min Zhongshu was appointed as an official by Situ Houba. But when he took office, Situ Houba only asked about his well-being and did not discuss matters of governance. Zhongshu lamented, "When I first received your appointment, I was both happy and afraid. Now that I have met you, I am neither excited nor fearful. If you think that Zhongshu lacks the wisdom to discuss politics, you should not have appointed me as an official. Since you have appointed me but do not make use of me, it shows a lack of discernment in people." He then resigned from his post and left with a letter of complaint.

instruction: Why do Chinese people celebrate the Lantern Festival?
output: Every 15th day of the first month of the lunar year is the Lantern Festival. According to records, the Lantern Festival originated in the Han Dynasty. After the death of Han Gaozu (Liu Bang), Lu Hou usurped power and the Lu clan controlled the court. Later, Zhou Bo, Chen Ping and others joined forces to eliminate the power of Lu Hou and enthroned Liu Heng as the Emperor Wen of Han. As the Lu clan was eliminated on the 15th night of the first month, Emperor Wen would go to the streets in plain clothes to celebrate with the people every year on that day after he ascended the throne. Gradually, it became a folk festival - the Lantern Festival.

instruction: Why is the hibiscus also called the "wood hibiscus"?
output:
In ancient times, "furong" was an alias for lotus. Now, it has become a dedicated term for shrubs or small trees in the mallow family of the plant world. In order to distinguish it from the ancient name, people call it "mu furong" (wooden lotus), hence the saying of wooden lotus and water lotus. The wooden lotus tree is 2-5 meters tall, with crowded branches and stems with soft hair. The leaves and flowers are arranged alternately and singly at the ends of the branches. The most famous lotus is the "San Zui Furong" (Three Drunken Lotus). As it opens as a white flower in the early morning, turns peach-colored at noon, and becomes purple-red in the evening, it is thus named.

There is also a more peculiar type of lotus than the "San Zui Furong", which changes color day by day after blooming for several days. It is white on the first day, yellow on the second, red on the third, and purple-red on the fourth. When it withers, it turns brown.

The wooden lotus is very commonly planted in China. In Chengdu, Sichuan, every deep autumn, thousands upon thousands of lotuses bloom on the streets and alleys, decorating the city like a beautiful painting, hence the name "Rongcheng" (City of Lotus).

instruction: There was a person who wanted to learn from a teacher. When the teacher was unwilling to teach, he said, "You must first read the text a hundred times." The saying goes, "Read a book a hundred times, and its meaning will reveal itself." The student said, "I am eager and impatient." The teacher replied, "You should use the three leftovers." When asked about the meaning of the "three leftovers," the teacher explained, "Winter is the leftover of the year, night is the leftover of the day, and cloudy and rainy days are the leftovers of the season."
output: There was a man who wanted to seek instruction from Dong Yu, but Dong Yu was unwilling to teach him. Instead, he said, "You must first read it a hundred times before then." What he meant was, "If you read a book a hundred times, its meaning will naturally reveal itself." The man seeking instruction said, "I don't have the time." To which Dong Yu replied, "You should make use of the 'three spares'." When asked about the meaning of "three spares", Dong Yu explained, "Winter is the spare time of the year (when you can read), night is the spare time of the day (when you can read), and rainy days are spare throughout the four seasons."

"Di Lianggong and Lou Shide both served as chancellors. Di Gong had been excluding Shide for a long time, so Empress Wu Zetian asked him, 'I have greatly favored you. Do you know why?' He replied, 'I have risen through my literary talent and straightforward ways, not by idly relying on others.' After a long pause, the Empress said, 'I have been unaware of your situation, and it is indeed Lou Shide's doing that you have been favored.' She then ordered her attendants to bring a basket, from which she took out over ten recommendation letters and presented them to Lianggong. After reading them, he became fearful and blamed himself. The Empress did not hold it against him. When he went out, he said, 'I never thought that I was being contained by Lou!' Meanwhile, Lou had never shown any signs of pride."

Di Renjie replied: "I have been trusted because of my literary talent and moral integrity, not because I have achieved nothing and rely on others." After a while, Wu Zetian said to him: "I used to not understand you, and it was all thanks to Lou Shide's recommendation that you were able to attain your high position." She then ordered her attendants to bring a document box and took out over ten memorials recommending Di Renjie. After reading them, Di Renjie was so frightened that he quickly admitted his mistake, and Wu Zetian did not rebuke him. After Di Renjie left, he said: "I never thought that I had been tolerated by Minister Lou all this time!" Meanwhile, Lou Shide never showed any signs of arrogance or pride.

instruction: Why should we drink more boiled water when we have a fever?
output:
For the human body, water is the most important substance, intricately linked to life itself. When running a high fever, a significant amount of bodily water is lost through evaporation from the respiratory tract and skin. Therefore, it is imperative to drink ample boiled water to replenish this loss; otherwise, dehydration will set in, compounding the illness. 

Moreover, water helps regulate body temperature. Drinking sufficient water enables the body to cool down through sweat evaporation or urinary excretion of excess heat. Additionally, certain illnesses are caused by pathogenic bacteria. Drinking ample water, which is then absorbed by the gastrointestinal tract and enters the bloodstream, can dilute and help eliminate the toxins produced by bacteria in the blood through urination. As high fevers often disrupt the body's metabolism and may lead to the presence of harmful substances in the blood, drinking ample water can dilute and remove these harmful substances, thereby reducing their adverse effects on the body.

instruction: What is bamboo?
output:
Bamboo is a perennial herbaceous plant of the Poaceae family and the Bambusoideae subfamily. The name bamboo originates from its ancient Chinese character, which pictorially depicts drooping bamboo leaves and has evolved into the modern Chinese character for bamboo.

Native to China, bamboo thrives in tropical, subtropical, and temperate regions. It is widely cultivated in China, particularly in provinces such as Sichuan, Chongqing, and Zhejiang. Bamboo is also found in some countries across Asia, Africa, and the Americas. Bamboo prefers a warm and humid climate and requires ample water and heat. It grows best in fertile, well-drained soil that is slightly acidic and rich in organic matter and mineral elements.

instruction: In Canada, before you decide whether to make a "U-turn" or not, you should first check?
output:
In Canada, before you decide to make a U-turn, you should first check the following key points:

1. **Traffic signs and signals**: Check for any signs or signal lights prohibiting U-turns. In some areas, U-turns may only be permitted at certain times or under certain conditions.

2. **Road markings**: Observe the road markings to ensure U-turns are allowed. A continuous double yellow line usually indicates that U-turns are not permitted.

3. **Traffic conditions**: Check the traffic flow in front, behind, and across from you to ensure that making a U-turn will not obstruct or endanger other vehicles or pedestrians.

4. **Visibility**: Ensure you have adequate visibility to make the U-turn safely, meaning you need to be able to see far enough to ensure other drivers have time to see you and react.

In any case, always exercise caution when making a U-turn and ensure that it does not lead to a traffic accident or a violation of traffic rules. If you are unsure whether it is safe to make a U-turn, it is best to choose an alternative location or method to change your direction. It is advisable to slow down and use your turn signals before making a U-turn to notify other drivers of your intention.

instruction: Why is human blood red in color?
output: The blood of humans is red because it contains red blood cells, which are composed of red protein. Also known as erythrocytes, red blood cells are the main component of blood, and they are responsible for transporting oxygen to various tissues and carrying carbon dioxide back to the lungs to be exhaled. Blood is to the human body as gasoline is to a machine; without blood, the human body would cease to function.

instruction: Why do the same-sized flat-screen TVs look different in size?
output:
Case content: Xiaohan encountered a puzzling problem when purchasing a new LCD TV recently. Even though she had done her research before shopping, when she compared the two models she was interested in at the store, she found that even though both were labeled as 32 inches, one of the screens seemed slightly smaller than the other. In theory, a component as standardized as a screen should not show such differences, so could it be that her vision was misleading her? However, Xiaohan firmly believes that her mild nearsightedness of only 100 degrees is not enough to cause such a misunderstanding. So, what is going on? How are screen sizes calculated? Is it true that products with the same dimensions can have screens of different sizes?

Expert interpretation: Screen size is actually the first thing consumers consider when purchasing a machine, but it is also the first thing that is overlooked. For most consumers, 32 inches or 42 inches are just concepts; they only differentiate between large and small sizes without any actual visual comparison. In fact, the screen size of LCD TVs is measured by the length of the diagonal of the TV screen, usually in inches (1 inch equals 2.538 centimeters).

Due to the characteristics of LCD screens, they are not covered by border lines, so generally speaking, the screen size of LCD TVs should be accurate, and because LCD screens are cut according to whole-size dimensions, they usually do not appear to be lacking in any way. However, this is usually the case; there are a very small number of manufacturers in the market who use non-A-grade screens or screens with inferior craftsmanship to reduce production costs, resulting in a discrepancy of 1 to 2 centimeters less than the standard size, making it seem slightly smaller. Another situation is that some manufacturers have to compromise on the size of the screen slightly to adjust the physical resolution of the screen. Therefore, it is best for consumers to choose well-known brands when purchasing LCD TVs to avoid this "short-changing" phenomenon.

instruction: The family instructions of Lord Bao, the Filial and Solemn, say: "For future generations of my descendants who enter officialdom, if any commit acts of corruption, they shall not be allowed to return to the clan. instruction:
Translation of the classical Chinese text:

The Emperor wanted to employ Anshi [Wang Anshi] in an important position. Tang Jie said that Anshi could not handle a major responsibility. The Emperor asked, "Is a man of letters not fit for the task? Is a scholar of the classics not fit? Is a man experienced in official matters not fit?" Jie replied, "Anshi is a diligent student, but he is stuck in the past. Therefore, his ideas are impractical. If he were to govern, he would surely make many changes." The Emperor did not agree and eventually appointed Anshi as a participant in political affairs. He said to Anshi, "People do not understand you because they think you are merely a scholar of the classics and do not comprehend the ways of the world." Anshi replied, "The classics are precisely what one should use to navigate the affairs of the world." The Emperor asked, "Then, what should be your first priority in implementing policies?" Anshi answered, "Changing the customs, establishing laws, and rectifying the current situation are the most pressing matters." The Emperor was deeply convinced by Anshi's response.
output: The Emperor (Song Renzong) wanted to employ Wang Anshi, and Tang Jie said: "Anshi is not capable of bearing great responsibilities." The Emperor asked: "Can he not be trusted in terms of literature? Can he not be trusted in terms of Confucian teachings? Can he not be trusted in terms of administrative affairs?" Tang Jie replied, "Anshi is diligent in learning but inflexible in thought. During previous discussions, his ideas and behavior were out of touch with reality. If he were to become an official, his policies would surely undergo frequent changes." However, the Emperor did not share this opinion and eventually appointed Wang Anshi as a participant in political affairs. The Emperor said to Wang, "Others do not understand you and believe that you only know Confucian classics and are unaware of worldly affairs." Wang Anshi replied, "Confucian teachings are precisely the means to plan and handle worldly affairs." The Emperor asked, "In your opinion, what policies should be implemented first?" Wang Anshi answered, "To change the current trends, rituals, and habits, new decrees must be promulgated. This is precisely what needs to be done urgently." The Emperor deeply believed and adopted Wang's suggestions.

instruction: Why do tornadoes form?
output:
A tornado is a formidable force of nature, with wind speeds often reaching several dozen to over a hundred meters per second. It is a vortex in the air. Within a strongly developing cumulonimbus cloud, the air turbulence is significant, with substantial variations in temperature, humidity, wind direction, and speed.

For instance, the wind speed of a downdraft can reach over level 8, while an updraft typically only reaches levels 3 to 4. This causes intense air turbulence within the cumulonimbus cloud, creating a rotational effect. When this rotational effect becomes strong enough, it forms a tornado.

Additionally, the drastic temperature difference between the upper and lower layers of the atmosphere, with cold air rapidly descending and warm air vigorously ascending, causes alternating disturbances in the air layers, forming numerous small vortices. As these small vortices expand, the turbulence between the layers intensifies, eventually forming a large vortex and, consequently, a tornado.

instruction: Question: What is the function of the brain?

Answer: The brain is one of the most important organs in the human body, responsible for controlling a person's consciousness, emotions, perception, and movement. The functions of the brain include:

Emotions: The brain is in charge of processing emotions, allowing people to experience happiness, anger, sadness, and joy.

Perception: The brain receives perceptual information from the outside world, such as visual, auditory, gustatory, olfactory, and tactile senses.

Movement: The brain controls the body's movement, enabling people to act.

Memory: The brain stores and retrieves memories, allowing people to learn and think.

Language: The brain processes language information, enabling people to understand and use language.

instruction: What is the XLSX file format?
output:
Files with the .XLSX extension are Microsoft Excel Open XML Format Spreadsheet files. It is a ZIP compressed file, a spreadsheet file based on XML and created by Microsoft Excel 2007 or later versions.

An XLSX file stores cell-editing data in a worksheet, and the worksheet is stored in a spreadsheet (a file may contain multiple worksheets). Cells in a spreadsheet are positioned by rows and columns and may contain styles, formats, mathematical functions, etc.

Earlier versions of Excel spreadsheet files were saved in the .XLS format, while .XLSM files are Excel template files that support macro command functions.

instruction: Please complete the following paragraph - On November 21, 1894, Lüshun fell.

On January 30, 1895, at 08:30, the Japanese army occupied the Mashi Heights Battery. The Qing army's land batteries immediately concentrated their fire on the Mashi Heights Battery, while the naval commander Ding Ruchang also led the "Dingyuan", "Jingyuan", "Laiyuan", "Guangbing", and several mosquito boats to near the South Bang Battery to provide supporting fire. The Japanese troops who captured the Mashi Heights Battery took advantage of the momentum to capture the weakly defended Long Temple Mouth Battery and used it to attack the Beiyang Fleet right in front of them. The sudden bombardment caught the Beiyang Fleet off guard, and one of the shells hit the observation port of the "Guangbing" command tower, killing the deputy captain, Huang Zulian. On February 1, the North Bang Battery fell, cutting off all land transportation to Weihaiwei. The defending Suijun army commander, Dai Zongquan, committed suicide. The Japanese army then repeatedly used light vessels to launch strong attacks on the Beiyang Fleet anchorage. After 04:00 on the 6th, the Japanese torpedo boat squad launched its fourth strong attack, while the army's artillery on the north shore of Weihai fired shells. The "Jingyuan", "Jiyuan", "Pingyuan", and "Guangbing" fired at the north shore, while the other ships fired at the torpedo boat squad. The Beiyang Fleet, heavily besieged and lacking aid, had only the "Pingyuan", "Jiyuan", and "Guangbing" still capable of fighting after many days of battle, and even these ships had run out of large-caliber artillery shells. Seeing no chance of breaking out and with no reinforcements in sight, Ding Ruchang ordered the damaged ships to be sunk to prevent them from falling into enemy hands. On the 9th, the "Guangbing" used torpedoes to sink the already stranded "Jingyuan", then approached the "Dingyuan" and placed 350 pounds of explosives in the middle of the ship. At 15:15, the explosives detonated, destroying the "Dingyuan's" engine room and causing its two funnels to collapse. On the 11th, Ding Ruchang committed suicide by poison. In the following days, the captain of the "Guangbing", Cheng Biguang, and the Weihai Logistics Department head, Niu Changpeng, boarded the "Matsushima" several times to discuss surrender. At 08:30 on the 17th, the Combined Fleet sailed into the port of Weihaiwei. instruction: Why can a single optical fiber simultaneously enable thousands of people to make phone calls?
output:
To enable optical fibers to transmit communications, we first need to convert voice and image signals into optical signals suitable for fiber optic transmission. In communication technology, this process is called "modulation" and is performed by a "modulator". The modulator can modulate different voice and image signals into optical signals with different frequency bands. Since the frequency band of light waves is very wide, there is a great deal of flexibility, and it can accommodate a large number of different telephone frequency bands.

In theory, on such a wide frequency band of optical fibers, it would be no problem to support one hundred million people talking at the same time. It is just that, in practice, due to limitations of the equipment for optical-electrical conversion, this capacity cannot be reached, but it is absolutely no problem to enable tens of thousands of phone calls to go through simultaneously without a hitch! In actual use, on an optical fiber thinner than a hair, tens of thousands of phone calls or thousands of television programs can be transmitted at the same time.

If we combine dozens of optical fibers into one optical cable, its capacity is beyond imagination.

Paragraph: Crossroads: According to the World Health Organization (WHO), essential medicines are those that "satisfy the priority health care needs of the population." These are the medicines that people should always have access to in adequate amounts. The WHO has published a model list of essential medicines. Each country is encouraged to prepare its own list according to local priorities. More than 150 countries have published official essential medicines lists. The essential medicines list enables health authorities, especially in developing countries, to optimize medicine resources. The WHO list contains a core list and a complementary list.

output: World Health Organization (WHO)

According to the 2011 Census of India, the population of the Poonch district of India is 476,820, ranking 548th in India (out of 640). The population density of the district is 285 people per square kilometer. The population growth rate during the decade of 2001-2011 was 27.97%. The gender ratio in Poonch is 890 females per 1,000 males, and the literacy rate is 68.69%. The region's population is 90.45% Muslim. Ethnic groups residing in the region include Gujjars, Bakerwals, Paharis, Punjabis, Kashmiris, and Rajputs. The Gujjars mainly reside in the hilly areas. Residents typically cultivate small plots of land and own a few cows. With the exception of Kashmiris, the rest of the population speaks the Bahari-Pothwari (Poonchi) language, and only a very small number of people may speak Dogri. Despite their differing beliefs, the common use of the Pahari language helps to unite the people with a shared ethos. 

Question: What was the population of Poonch, India in 2011?

Answer: The population of Poonch, India in 2011 was 476,820.
output: 476,820 people
